comments:
I have a utility class that uses an inner class.  This class runs without issue 
on the command line and within my application server.  When I try to use this 
utility class from inside of my Eclipse plug-in that I'm developing, I receive 
the following error.  A copy of the utility class can be made available upon 
request.

Log: Thu Jan 31 15:27:34 CST 2002
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Thu Jan 31 15:27:34 CST 2002
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 Logging
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Logging
	at ClassSearch.init(ClassSearch.java:132)
	at ClassSearch.main(ClassSearch.java:143)
	at com.sybase.alphabet.easerver.view.RepositoryView.connectEAServer
(com/sybase/alphabet/easerver/view/RepositoryView.java:108)
	at com.sybase.alphabet.easerver.view.RepositoryView.access$000
(com/sybase/alphabet/easerver/view/RepositoryView.java:29)
	at com.sybase.alphabet.easerver.view.RepositoryView$1.run
(com/sybase/alphabet/easerver/view/RepositoryView.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection
(ActionContributionItem.java:407)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetEvent
(ActionContributionItem.java:361)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$0
(ActionContributionItem.java:352)
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent
(ActionContributionItem.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:634)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1282)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1092)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:673)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:656)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:815)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:433)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:306)

I obtained Jason's source file from the newsgroup, and I wasn't able to 
reproduce.  I put the ClassSearch file in the jar of a simple plugin, and at 
runtime it was able to load the nested "Logging" class without difficulty.

URLClassLoader is a standard part of the JDK, so I don't understand what's 
really going on here. I think I'll need more information about Jason's 
environment to reproduce...

- are you placing ClassSearch in a JAR file, or are you using "-dev bin" to 
specify the build folder?
- Is there a simpler reproducible test case, or is it only reproducible when 
running CORBA, etc?
- Do the runtime tracing options give you any more leads?

Closing this PR.  There is no problem with loading inner classes in general, and 
I couldn't reproduce a problem with Jason's source file.  I believe this is due 
to the problem outlined in:

http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=8907
